description: creates a time stamp for expire times
name: expiresin
readme:
# expires-in The [expires-in](https:wavecoders.ca/) library exported as [Node.js](https:nodejs.org/) modules. ## Docs Generates a Expiry Time in milliseconds. ## Installation ``` npm install expiresin ``` ## Structure There are 2 paramiters - the second is optional The first is the time to expires: {seconds:0, minutes:0, hours:0, days:0, days30:0, years:0} You can include 1 or all of the above options ex: {days:15} expires in 15 days. For a calculation of a month, its based on days30 (30 days) The second paramiter is optional - default is current date/time stamp The startDateMilliseconds MUST be in milliseconds for this paramiter ``` var expires = expiresIn({days:15}); ``` If no expiry time is provided, default is 30 days expiry ``` var expires = expiresIn(); ``` ## Create a License Key To create an expiry time of 15 days from current date and time ``` var expiresIn = require('expiresin'); var expires = expiresIn({days:15}); ``` To create an expiry time of 15 days from a specific date and time ``` var expiresIn = require('expiresin'); var expires = expiresIn({days:15}, 2778174905); ``` ## Support Tested in Chrome 53-54, Firefox 48-49, IE 11, Edge 14, Safari 9-10, Node.js 6-7, & PhantomJS 2.1.1.
Automated test runs are available.
